results.title: Treatment With Lisinopril Prevents the Early Progression of Glomerular Injury in Obese Dahl Salt-Sensitive Rats Independent of Lowering Arterial Pressure
results.text_hl: Another major finding in the current study is that chronic treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ significantly reduced arterial pressure in lean SS @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ but not in the @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ SSLepRmutant @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

results.title: Nocturnal reduction of blood pressure and the antihypertensive response to a diuretic or angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor in obese hypertensive patients. TROPHY Study Group.
results.text_hl: Results of 24-h ABP data show that both @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ are effective therapies for @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@-related @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and that response to treatment is influenced by sex, race, and dipper/nondipper status.

results.title: The ACE-inhibitor lisinopril affects plasma insulin levels but not fibrinolytic parameters.
results.text_hl: Therefore the present study examines the relationship between @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ and @GENE_SERPINE1 @GENE_5054 @@@PAI-1@@@ plasma levels during intravenous @CHEMICAL_Glucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005947 @@@glucose@@@ tolerance tests before and after administration with the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@-inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ in 12 male @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with angiographically proven @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ and borderline @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@.

results.title: Blood pressure control and cardiovascular outcomes in normal-weight, overweight, and obese hypertensive patients treated with three different antihypertensives in ALLHAT.
results.text_hl: A significant interaction (P = 0.004) suggests a lower @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ risk in the @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ for @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ versus @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ (hazard ratio 0.85, 95% confidence interval 0.74-0.98) and a significant interaction (P = 0.011) suggests a higher risk of @DISEASE_Kidney_Failure_Chronic @DISEASE_MESH:D007676 @@@end-stage renal disease@@@ for @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ versus @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ participants (hazard ratio 1.49, 95% confidence interval 1.06-2.08).

results.title: PECULIARITIES OF PHARMACOTHERAPY IN ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION AND COMORBID PATHOLOGY.
results.journal: Rev Med Chir Soc Med Nat Iasi
results.text_hl: MATERIAL AND METHODS: 60 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@AH@@@, @DISEASE_Coronary_Artery_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003324 @@@coronary artery disease@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Obesity</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obesity@@@ were divided into three groups: 1st group was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ (regimen I); 2nd group was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ (regimen II); 3rd group was treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Indapamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007190 @@@indapamide@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@ (regimen III).

citations.NLM: Tofan N, Marish M, Shtanko V. PECULIARITIES OF PHARMACOTHERAPY IN ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION AND COMORBID PATHOLOGY. Rev Med Chir Soc Med Nat Iasi. 2015 Oct-Dec;119(4):1092-7. PMID: 26793854
citations.BibTeX: @article{26793854, title={PECULIARITIES OF PHARMACOTHERAPY IN ARTERIAL HYPERTENSION AND COMORBID PATHOLOGY.}, author={Tofan N and Marish M and Shtanko V}, journal={Rev Med Chir Soc Med Nat Iasi}, volume={119}, number={4}, pages={1092-7}}
